Material used.Description: Studies were conducted using SNCA A53T transgenic mice to model Parkinson's disease.

Readout description.Result Description: SNCA A53T transgenic mice exhibited increased α-synuclein aggregation and neurodegeneration compared to wild-type controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed across independent mouse cohorts.

Technical replicates.Description: Technical replicates were not explicitly mentioned.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type mice were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transgenic littermates were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare group differences.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: α-synuclein aggregation levels below 20% of wild-type levels

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: α-synuclein aggregation levels exceeding 50% of wild-type levels

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with SNCA A30P plasmids to study protein aggregation.

Readout description.Result Description: SNCA A30P-expressing HEK293 cells showed moderate α-synuclein aggregation compared to wild-type cells.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type plasmid was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test was used for comparison between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: α-synuclein aggregation levels below 30% of wild-type levels

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: α-synuclein aggregation levels exceeding 60% of wild-type levels
